abstract.p: Knoll's Imago is new hard-surface material, comprised of elegant textiles encased between two sheets of plastic; (Currents); photo (S)

block.p: Encase elegant textiles between two sheets of plastic and the result is moire effects, translucency and subtle patterns. Knoll's Imago, a new hard-surface material, can be used in place of Formica or glass. The 4-by-8-foot sheets can be cut or bent into tabletops or shelves, wall panels and screens. It is available in eight patterns, including thin pinstripes, squares and moires, and 24 colors. It costs $12 to $38 a square foot for thicknesses from 1/16 to 1/2 inch. At Knoll, 105 Wooster Street (Spring Street).
